meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog was snarfing down its food.
meanings.sent2: She was snarfing her ice cream before it melted.
meanings.sent3: The kids were snarfing their snacks like they hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed down the sandwich in record time.
meanings.sent5: The raccoon was snarfing up the berries from the bush.

meanings.definition: To inhale or consume something quickly and enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The baby was snarfing in the delicious smell of freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent2: She was snarfing the aroma of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef was snarfing in the delightful scents coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed in the fresh air of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The puppy was snarfing in the scent of the ocean breeze.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly and slyly.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky raccoon was snarfing the shiny objects from the campsite.
meanings.sent2: She was snarfing the cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was snarfing the toy mouse from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed the pen from the desk without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent5: The magpie was snarfing the colorful beads from the necklace.
